name: Half Day
raw_text:
=== TOUR START: Half Day ===
Skip to main content
Skip to primary sidebar
Salty Dog Sea Kayaking
Full Day Tropical Island Tour
6 Day Kayaking Expedition
Half Day Inner Island  Turtle Tour
This is without doubt our most popular guided trip – designed to be appreciated by both experienced paddlers and beginners alike, with the emphasis on fun and enjoyment.
The Half Day Inner Island Turtle Tour is our most popular guided trip.
It can be appreciated by both experienced paddlers and beginners, with the emphasis on fun and enjoyment.
Departing from our base at Shute Harbour, we kayak over fringing coral reefs and explore nearby tropical islands.
These turquoise waters and islands are home to an amazing diversity of marine and bird-life including sea turtles and soaring eagles.
Between July and September, there is also a chance to encounter the magnificent humpback whales which arrive to give birth before returning to the Antarctic.
Stopping off at one of the unique close-by beaches or islands, there is an opportunity to swim and explore.
Some people prefer to kick back and relax, while our guides share their local knowledge.
Cold drinks, muesli bars and fruit platter are provided, allowing time to refresh before heading back to Shute Harbour.
Clients are welcome to assist with packing up the kayaks at the  end of the day.
NOTE: Medium level fitness required. Weather conditions can change during kayaking tour.
Closed Christmas Day, Boxing Day and New Year’s Day
For details on our Full Day Tropical Island Tour:
For details on kayak hire:
For details on Island camping transfers:
$100 under 15 years old
Beginners to experienced paddlers
Children welcome -age 7 upwards, (1 adult per child)
Medium level fitness required
dry bag for towel or spare clothes, (we cannot guarantee to keep sensitive electronics dry)
shoes that are suitable for getting wet (thongs, sandals or deck shoes are suitable)
Wear clothing appropriate for the weather
PO Box 1176 Airlie Beach, QLD, Australia, 4802
(Kayaking base at Shute Harbour)
Give us a shout on
Leave us a Review

End Google Tag Manager (noscript)

=== TOUR END: Half Day ===
[ALL PRICE LINES FOUND IN HTML:]
$120
$100 under 15 years old

name: Full Day
raw_text:
=== TOUR START: Full Day ===
Skip to main content
Skip to primary sidebar
Salty Dog Sea Kayaking
Full Day Tropical Island Tour
6 Day Kayaking Expedition
Full Day Tropical Island Kayak and Snorkel Adventure
Enjoy a great day sea kayaking the Whitsunday Islands with an experienced guide and a small group of paddlers.
Kayaking from our waterfront base at Shute Harbour, we paddle the inner islands before heading out to nearby White Rock.
Here, we spend time relaxing and swimming before crossing to South Molle Island.
The waters off the Molle Islands are home to turtles, dolphins, soaring sea eagles and a myriad of colourful tropical fish. The migrating humpback whales can be spotted when they frequent the area between July and September.
There is time to trek Mount Jeffries Walking Track, lined with ancient grass trees which attract many varieties of butterflies. The walk boasts panoramic views across the Whitsunday Islands, the Conway State Forest, Sandy Bay and Shute Harbour.
If conditions are favourable, there may be an opportunity to snorkel the fringing coral reef.
A mouth-watering beach-based buffet lunch is provided before kayaking back to Shute Harbour in the afternoon.
This tour provides participants the opportunity to gain a more intimate connection with this magical part of the world.
Tours run June to the end of September.
$220 (includes lunch, reef tax and GST)
Beginners to experienced kayakers (Age 15 and over)
(medium level of fitness required)
Minimum numbers of 6 people required to run this trip
Between 10 -15 kms
kayaking and safety briefing
shoes that are fine to get wet (thongs, sandals or deck shoes).
PO Box 1176 Airlie Beach, QLD, Australia, 4802
(Kayaking base at Shute Harbour)
Give us a shout on
Leave us a Review
Google Tag Manager (noscript)
End Google Tag Manager (noscript)
var sbiajaxurl = "https://www.saltydog.com.au/wp-admin/admin-ajax.php";
=== TOUR END: Full Day ===
[ALL PRICE LINES FOUND IN HTML:]
$220 (includes lunch, reef tax and GST)

name: 6 Day
raw_text:
=== TOUR START: 6 Day ===
Skip to main content
Skip to primary sidebar
Salty Dog Sea Kayaking
Full Day Tropical Island Tour
6 Day Kayaking Expedition
best shot kayaks snorkel keyhole
6 DAY GUIDED WHITSUNDAY KAYAK TOUR
This is the ultimate in overnight kayaking expeditions. Spend 6 days exploring the Whitsunday wilderness, with our friendly and informative guides.
This 6 Day Sea Kayaking Expedition is the ultimate overnight sea kayaking expedition in the Whitsunday Islands.  Spend 5 full days sea kayaking, snorkelling and exploring the Whitsunday wilderness with our expert sea kayak guides.
Immerse yourself in the sparkling turquoise waters that lap the white silica sands of Whitehaven Beach.
Marvel at the iconic views from Hill Inlet and enter an amazing underwater world of fringing coral reefs.  Snorkeling, bush walking and camping out under the stars are all part of the experience you will never forget.
See one of our short Mantaray videos here
6 – 11 June 2026
13 – 17 June 2026
18 – 23 July 2026
01 – 06 August  2026.
15 -20 August 2026
29 August – 03 Sept 2026
12 -17 Sept 2026
26 sept – 01 Oct 2026
Private group trips available throughout the year please call or email directly to discuss.
COST 2026 $3,295 per person
Today is your day to arrive and settle in to our group hotel. You will meet your guides and we will hand out any required equipment and provide a briefing on the upcoming adventure.
After your pick up from our group hotel in Airlie Beach we are transferred directly to our Shute Harbour base. Kayakers, kayaks and supplies are then transported by fast water taxi to iconic Whitehaven Beach – on the southeast of Whitsunday Island. Camp is set up and the rest of the day is spent exploring nearby Haselwood Island. The snorkeling here is simply brilliant with colourful fringing coral gardens and prolific marine life. Schools of electric blue damsels, delicate angel and exotic butterfly fish are amongst the fish that are regularly spotted here.
After returning to camp, the group has the opportunity to take in a short bushwalk to the Chance Bay Lookout. Stunning views over the southern end of Whitsunday Island to the islands beyond is a great reward for the effort.  As the afternoon comes to a close, sit on the beach and enjoy the tranquility brought on by the setting of the sun.
The white silica sands of Whitehaven Beach form a perfect backdrop as the group paddles north – following the coastline –usually with the assistance of the following south-easterly trade winds.  Kayakers stop off near the entrance of Hill Inlet for a swim and walk to the world-renowned lookout with its breathtaking views. Green sea turtles and stingrays swim near the entrance to the lookout and can be spotted from the top.  After a well-earned break, paddlers continue north following the east coast to the Cairn Camp Site.
An early morning walk to the Cairn Lookout makes for breath taking views across Hook Island and Border Island. After breakfast, the next leg of the journey ends at the stunning Crayfish Beach on Hook Island. This is often described as the best campsite in the region and is set against the backdrop of Mackerel Bay. The coral here is world-class and schools of fish can be spotted negotiating the maze of mangrove roots that line the inlet to the north of the campsite.
The group kayaks around the north-eastern tip of Hook Island (also called the Pinnacles) to the protected northern waters. After a snorkel at one of the many bays, the next stop is Maureen’s Cove where the groups set up for the night. Maureen’s Cove is a renowned snorkelling site with easy access from the coral beach.  It boasts an array of underwater valleys and caves and abundant marine life including giant Maori Wrasse and Manta Rays.
Paddlers pack up their gear one final time and head west towards Bali Hai a tiny picturesque island surrounded by colourful coral. This area attracts large parrot fish and coral trout that can be spotted swimming throughout the coral gardens.  The group then 
=== TOUR END: 6 Day ===
[ALL PRICE LINES FOUND IN HTML:]
COST 2026 $3,295 per person
$2695 per person
